channel.title: Nature
channel.description: Nature is the foremost international weekly scientific journal in the world and is the flagship journal for Nature Portfolio. It publishes the finest peer-reviewed research in all fields of science and technology on the basis of its originality, importance, interdisciplinary interest, timeliness, accessibility, elegance and surprising conclusions. Nature publishes landmark papers, award winning news, leading comment and expert opinion on important, topical scientific news and events that enable readers to share the latest discoveries in science and evolve the discussion amongst the global scientific community.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Toughened self-assembled monolayers for durable perovskite solar cells
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 17 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09509-7

Cross-linkable co-SAMs improve hole-selective SAM stability, preventing defects and thermal degredation in perovskite solar cells, enabling 26.92% efficiency with high heat durability, and guiding the design of more efficient and durable solar cells.
item.dc:title: Toughened self-assembled monolayers for durable perovskite solar cells
item.dc:creator: Wenlin Jiang
Geping Qu

item.title: Atomic-scale imaging of frequency-dependent phonon anisotropy
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 17 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09511-z

A new form of momentum-selective electron energy-loss spectroscopy enables the element-resolved imaging of frequency- and symmetry-dependent vibrational anisotropies with atomic resolution.
item.dc:title: Atomic-scale imaging of frequency-dependent phonon anisotropy
item.dc:creator: Xingxu Yan
Paul M. Zeiger

item.title: A room temperature rechargeable all-solid-state hydride ion battery
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 17 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09561-3

A core-shell hydride 3CeH3@BaH2, which exhibits fast H− conduction at ambient temperature and becomes a superionic conductor above 60 °C, is used to construct an all-solid-state rechargeable H− battery.
item.dc:title: A room temperature rechargeable all-solid-state hydride ion battery
item.dc:creator: Jirong Cui

item.title: Daily briefing: A ‘time crystal’ made visible to the naked eye
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 16 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03023-6

Physicists have created a form of matter once thought physically impossible. Plus, the rise of religious chatbots and the debate over ‘mirror life’ heats up.
item.dc:title: Daily briefing: A ‘time crystal’ made visible to the naked eye
item.dc:creator: Flora Graham
